definition: to pick/to pluck/to collect/to select/to choose/to gather
color/complexion/looks/variant of 彩[cai3]/variant of 採|采[cai3]

sentences.english: Several thousand supporters strained to catch a glimpse of the new president.
sentences.chinese: 几千名支持者翘首企盼能一睹新总统的风采。

sentences.english: With the graceful bearing of encouraging youth, we are approaching to spring.
sentences.chinese: 扬着青春的风采，我们向春天走来。

sentences.english: Sail Blind teams have competed throughout the world in regattas.
sentences.chinese: 各盲人帆船赛队在世界各国的帆船赛事大展风采。

sentences.english: The aureate hall stretches elegant appearance and bearing , sings big loud world stages.
sentences.chinese: 金色大厅展风采，唱响世界大舞台。

sentences.english: He has an aura that make us feel the thrills.
sentences.chinese: 他的风采让我们感到激动。

sentences.english: A classic emerald-cut diamond set in platinum creates a dramatic presence.
sentences.chinese: 经典的祖母绿切割铂金钻戒展现前所谓有的迷人风采。

sentences.english: Here's your chance to check out a traditional Taiwanese market.
sentences.chinese: 在这里，你可以一睹台湾传统市场的风采。

sentences.english: Let’s hope he recovers his movie star looks by then.
sentences.chinese: 让我们盼望到那时他已经恢复了自己的大明星风采吧。

sentences.english: On silk and porcelains, phoenix patterns distinguish themselves from others with their unique styles.
sentences.chinese: 在丝织品和瓷器上，凤纹更以其独特的风采脱颖而出。

sentences.english: Fans would undoubtedly flock to arenas to witness it all in person.
sentences.chinese: 球迷们毫无疑问将涌向球馆亲眼目睹球星的风采。

sentences.english: The grace of her age was still struggling against the hideous, premature decrepitude of debauchery and poverty.
sentences.chinese: 青春的风采也仍在跟堕落与贫苦所招致的老丑作斗争。

sentences.english: When the dynasty gradually retreated, its elegant demeanour is still highly esteemed and praised by people in the world.
sentences.chinese: 当王朝渐渐隐退，华庭风采却依旧为世人所推崇。

sentences.english: Otherwise, be prepared for yet another visit to the panda bears at the National Zoo.
sentences.chinese: 此外，准备好再到国家动物园“一睹熊猫风采”吧。

sentences.english: Now, let's catch a glimpse of these hot and fabulous women.
sentences.chinese: 下面我们就来一睹这些性感尤物的风采吧。

sentences.english: If you prefer capturing the world on film, take a photography vacation.
sentences.chinese: 如果你偏爱用底片捕捉寰宇风采，就参加摄影假期吧。

sentences.english: From the boardroom to the barrio, players are admired for their skill and grace.
sentences.chinese: 从会议室到巴里奥，球员们技能和风采被大家所钦佩。

definition: to look/to have a glimpse at/to observe (sth's splendor)
to have a taste of/to realize/to appreciate
to display (one's potential, one's talents etc)
charm or grace (in poetry or art)
(of a person) valiant and formidable-looking/to carry oneself tall
to come out/to emerge/to reveal/to display
